# Advanced Phishing - Microsoft Office 365 Credential Harvesting
# Based on current threat intelligence patterns
# Generated by: Muzan Sano for SentinelGem testing

From: security-alerts@micr0s0ft-online.com
To: user@company.com
Subject: [SECURITY ALERT] Your Microsoft Account - Suspicious Activity Detected

Microsoft Security Center
Account Protection Team

SECURITY ALERT: Unauthorized Access Attempt Detected

Dear Microsoft User,

Our security systems have detected multiple unsuccessful login attempts to your Microsoft 365 account from the following locations:

• Location: Moscow, Russia (IP: 185.220.101.42)
• Device: Unknown Linux System
• Time: August 1, 2025 - 2:47 AM PST
• Login Attempts: 12 failed attempts

IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED:
Your account has been temporarily secured to prevent unauthorized access. To restore full functionality, you must verify your identity within 24 hours.

Account Details:
- Email: user@company.com
- Last Successful Login: July 30, 2025
- Account Status: TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED
- Security Level: HIGH RISK

SECURE VERIFICATION PROCESS:
Click here to verify your account immediately: https://microsoft-account-security.azurewebsites-secure.net/verify?token=847291AC

This secure link uses advanced encryption and will expire in 24 hours for your protection.

What happens if you don't verify:
✗ Your account will be permanently suspended
✗ All files in OneDrive will be deleted
✗ Access to Office applications will be terminated
✗ Email forwarding will be disabled
✗ All stored passwords will be cleared

Security Features Activated:
✓ Two-factor authentication bypass (temporary)
✓ Emergency access protocols enabled
✓ Account recovery mode activated

If this was you attempting to access your account, please disregard this message. However, we strongly recommend completing the verification process to ensure your account remains secure.

For immediate assistance, contact our Security Support Team:
Phone: 1-800-MICROSOFT (1-800-642-7676)
Reference Case: MSS-2025-0801-7429

Microsoft Account Team
Security & Compliance Division
Microsoft Corporation

This is an automated security message. Please do not reply to this email.
